alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 8:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Appomattox. In south central Virginia, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water may be flowing over a few roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain has exited the area. However, runoff from between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rainfall which occurred in a few locations earlier this morning continues to collect in local creeks and streams, and will result in minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Branch Wards Fork Creek, Butterwood Creek, Beaverpond Branch, Bowler Creek, Appomattox River, Falling River, Bear Creek and Caldwells Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Red House... Pamplin City... Evergreen... Madisonville... Hixburg... Abilene... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
